jacs.demos

Class PololuSweepTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • jacs.demos.PololuSweepTester

  • public class PololuSweepTester
extends java.lang.Object
    Program to run through the full range of motion [0,254] on each pin. Usage: This tool can be used to

    Verify the correct port was used to connect. See SystemPortsList for details and jacs.demos.ViewSerialPortsList tools.

    Calibrate the min and max values for each servo. If a servo "grinds" towards the ends of the range rather than continuing to move, the values of [0,254] should be clamped to a narrow range to avoid burning out the motor.

    Details:

    Correctly calibrated animatronics show movements, once a show has been properly computed and synchronized in software or hardware, depend on a combination of individual servo characteristics and servo controller card configuration.

    The Pololu card provided to UIST contestants has been preconfigured so that each of the 6 channels have been set to the widest minimum and maximum microsecond range for the HS-485HB, which is [608, 2400].

    The code base uses an 8-bit range [0,254] to generate commands that span the [608,2400] to ideally control servo angular position of [0,180].

    Ideal, however, may damage your servo by pushing it beyond it's actualy operating range, particularly the HS-82MG microservo. Contestants should adjust the actual min and max of the 8-bit range based on their own calibration results, which are easily determined using this tool to experiment with correct ranges.

    By modifying the values in these parallel arrays, contestants can easily enable and disable the sweep test per pin and adjust the min and max values per pin, based on individual servos attached to each. In this example, the min and max range for servo on pin 2 is limited to [30, 220] and commands have been disabled for pins 0, 1 and 5.

    public static int[] pinsToTest = 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

    static int[] minServoPosition = 0, 0, 30, 0, 0, 0

    public static int[] maxServoPosition = 254, 254, 220, 254, 254,254

    boolean[] testEnabled = false, false, true, true, true, false

    Experiment with timing values that on platform and data.

    SERIAL_COMMAND_PAUSE - is used to delay between sending serial commands. Changes to this will affect the speed and smoothness of the servo sweep. In a show mode, when commands to different servos are interleaved per frame, number may need to be adjusted. The equivalent number for show playback is in jacs.player.Timer_Settings.

    OBSERVER_PAUSE - slows down the time between each sweep for observation.

    Author:
    Ginger Alford

      This performs a sweep test on all pins that are enabled in the static data arrays testEnabled using pin-specific min and max values as specified in the minServoPosition and maxServoPosition.
      static void sweepTest(int pin, int start, int stop, int pause)
      This sends a series of uniformly timed and spaced commands to sweep the servo through a full range of positions represented in the range [0,254]

                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException

      • sweepTest

        public static void sweepTest()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This performs a sweep test on all pins that are enabled in the static data arrays testEnabled using pin-specific min and max values as specified in the minServoPosition and maxServoPosition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if there is an error opening or writing to the serial port

      • positionTest

                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sweepTest

        public static void sweepTest(int pin,
             int start,
             int stop,
             int pause)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This sends a series of uniformly timed and spaced commands to sweep the servo through a full range of positions represented in the range [0,254]
        Parameters:
        pin - pin on controller to which servo is attached
        start - beginning position of sweep expressed in the range [ 0,254]
        stop - ending position of sweep expressed in the range [ 0,254]
        pause - delay in microseconds between issues of commands to serial port
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
